   Jim Carrey
   stated on June 30, 2015 in a Twitter post:
   The California governor "says yes to poisoning more children with mercury
   and aluminum" in vaccines.

"California Gov says yes to poisoning more children with mercury and
   aluminum in manditory [sic] vaccines," Carrey posted on Twitter on June
   30.

We do
   have scientific evidence that there are bad diseases that aluminum in
   vaccines can prevent: cancer with the Human Papillomavirus vaccine,
   Diphtheria with the DTaP vaccine, and so on."

That makes aluminum toxicity exceedingly rare – even as immunization rates
   have increased over time, said Dr. Paul Offit, a professor of pediatrics
   in the infectious  diseases division at The Children’s Hospital of
   Philadelphia.
